description: A simple overview of instance performance.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE (("counter" = 'Transactions/sec' AND "instance" =~ /^Total/ ) OR "counter" = 'SQL Re-Compilations/sec' OR "counter" = 'SQL Compilations/sec' OR "counter" = 'Batch Requests/sec') AND "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "counter"
SELECT max("value") FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE "counter" = 'User Connections'  AND "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "counter" fill(null)

panels.description: Runnable task count per scheduler. Spikes in runnable tasks could mean CPU pressure.
panels.title: Runnable Tasks

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_difference(last("value")) FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE "counter" = 'Number of Deadlocks/sec' AND "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "counter","instance"
SELECT max("value") FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE ("counter" = 'Processes blocked')  AND "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "counter" fill(null)
SELECT sum("ErrorCount") FROM "RunTimeErrorLog" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$Host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

panels.description: This graph shows the total accumulated wait for a given chunk of time.

targets.query:
SELECT  non_negative_derivative(last("wait_time_ms"), $__interval) * 1.0
FROM    "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_waitstats"
WHERE   "host" =~ /^$Host$/
        AND $timeFilter
        AND "wait_type" <> 'VDI_CLIENT_OTHER'
        AND "wait_type" <> 'PWAIT_EXTENSIBILITY_CLEANUP_TASK'
GROUP BY
        time($__interval), "wait_type"

panels.title: Wait Stats - Total/Interval

panels.description: This graph shows the average wait per task. This number is calculated by dividing total wait time for a given period of time, divided by the total number of tasks that have accumulated that wait type in that same period of time.

targets.query:
SELECT  non_negative_derivative(last("wait_time_ms"), $__interval)/non_negative_derivative(last("waiting_tasks_count"), $__interval)
FROM    "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_waitstats"
WHERE   "host" =~ /^$Host$/
        AND $timeFilter
        AND "wait_type" <> 'VDI_CLIENT_OTHER'
        AND "wait_type" <> 'PWAIT_EXTENSIBILITY_CLEANUP_TASK'
GROUP BY time($__interval), "wait_type"

panels.title: Waits per Task

panels.description:
This graph can be used to determine if an instance is CPU bound or if other factors are affecting throughput. 

 - *Waiting for CPU* - Time spent waiting in line to get time on the CPU
 - *Waiting for Other Resources* - Time spent waiting on things other than the CPU, like waiting on disk, or waiting to write to a page in memory

Some amount of waiting is fine and expected. This graph is broken out per core to help normalize the output for comparison across multiple instances.

targets.query:
SELECT  ((sum("signal_wait") * 1.0)/$Cores) AS "CPU", (sum("resource_wait") * 1.0) / $Cores AS "Other Resources"
FROM (
SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("signal_wait_time_ms"),$__interval) AS "signal_wait", non_negative_derivative(last("resource_wait_ms"),$__interval) AS "resource_wait"
FROM    "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_waitstats"
WHERE   "host" =~ /^$Host$/
        AND $timeFilter
        AND "wait_type" <> 'VDI_CLIENT_OTHER'
        AND "wait_type" <> 'PWAIT_EXTENSIBILITY_CLEANUP_TASK'
GROUP BY
        time($__interval), "wait_type"
)
WHERE
$timeFilter
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Time Waiting (Per core, based on $Cores cores)

panels.description: This shows both the free space in TempDB as well as the current amount of Version Store usage by RCSI.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND ( "counter" = 'Free Space in tempdb (KB)' OR "counter" = 'Version Store Size (KB)' ) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "server", "counter", time($interval)

panels.title: TempDB Usage

panels.description: Temp table and table variable statistics.

targets.query: SELECT max("value") FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE ("counter" = 'Active Temp Tables' OR "counter" = 'Temp Tables For Destruction') AND "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "server", "counter",time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE ("counter" = 'Temp Tables Creation Rate') AND "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Temp Tables

panels.description:
*General*
All of the metrics here should be looked at over time and not in an isolated time period. There are general guidelines out there, but it makes most sense to just look for abnormal elevated values.

- *Page Life Expectancy*: This is a measure of how long on average a *data* page can live in the buffer pool before being aged out, or evicted from memory pressure. 
- *Lazy Writes/sec*: Measure of how many dirty (altered) pages from the buffer pool are being flushed to disk per second.
- *Page reads/sec*: Number of data pages being read *FROM* physical disk per second. Higher than normal values indicate increased memory pressure.
- *Page writes/sec*: Similar to reads, this is the number of physical page writes per second. Higher than normal values indicate increased memory pressure.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE ("counter" = 'Page life expectancy' AND "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "instance"

SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s) FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND ( "counter" = 'Page writes/sec' OR "counter" = 'Page reads/sec' OR "counter" = 'Lazy writes/sec' ) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "counter"

panels.title: Memory Performance

panels.description: This graph shows the amount of data written to each database during a given time period.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(sum("write_bytes"), $__interval) FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_database_io" WHERE ("host" =~ /(?i)^$Host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "database_name" fill(none) offset 1

panels.title: Data Writes/Database

panels.description: This graph shows the amount of data read from each database during a given time period.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(sum("read_bytes"), $__interval) FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_database_io" WHERE ("host" =~ /(?i)^$Host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "database_name" fill(previous) offset 1

panels.title: Data Reads/Database

panels.description: This graph shows you general information on data being flushed from the log buffer to the transaction logs on disk. Increased values relate directly with increased workload.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("value"), 1s) FROM "$RetentionPolicy"."sqlserver_performance" WHERE ("counter" = 'Log Bytes Flushed/sec' OR "counter" = 'Log Flushes/sec' ) AND "instance" = 'Total' AND "host" =~ /^(?i)$Host$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),"counter"

panels.title: Log Flushes

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES ON stig FROM "sqlserver_server_properties" WITH KEY = "host"
list.name: Host
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES ON stig FROM "sqlserver_server_properties" WITH KEY = "host"

title: Performance Overview
